intro: Cryptantha longiseta, commonly known as the long-stemmed cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has slender, branching stems and small, pinnately compound leaves. Cryptantha longiseta is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid conditions.
